channel.description: Recent content in Itsbuiltin on Math2001's blog

item.title: Bash Find
item.description: The find command in bash is quite powerful, and knowing the basics might save you some scripting. What does it do? It “finds” files. By default, it outputs their path relative to where you ran find. But, in addition of providing you with advanced “filters” it actually allows you to run commands on each of those files. Let’s get started! The basics With this structure: . ├── app │ ├── index.

item.title: The string module in Python
item.description: If you want the list of every letter, just do: >>> import string >>> print(string.ascii_uppercase) ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ
